org.roug.osnine

Interface Bus8Motorola

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MemoryBus
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BusStraight

    public interface Bus8Motorola
extends MemoryBus
    Bus in a computer - Motorola-style. Links CPU, memory and devices together.

    • Method Detail

      • signalIRQ

        void signalIRQ(boolean state)
        Accept a signal on the IRQ pin. A device can raise the voltage on the IRQ pin, which means the device sends an interrupt request. The CPU must then check the devices and get the device to lower the signal again. In this implementation, the signals from several devices are ORed together to the same pin on the CPU. Since this can't easily be emulated, it is the responsibility of the device that it doesn't raise IRQ twice in a row. If IRQs are ignored when a device signals, then it must be received when IRQs are accepted again (if the device hasn't lowered it).
        Parameters:
        state - - true if IRQ is raised from the device, false if IRQ is lowered.

      • signalFIRQ

        void signalFIRQ(boolean state)
        Accept an FIRQ signal.
        Parameters:
        state - - true if IRQ is raised from the device, false if IRQ is lowered.

      • signalNMI

        void signalNMI(boolean state)
        Accept an NMI signal.
        Parameters:
        state - - true if IRQ is raised from the device, false if IRQ is lowered.

      • isIRQActive

        boolean isIRQActive()
        Do we have active IRQs?
        Returns:
        true if there are active IRQs on the bus.

      • isNMIActive

        boolean isNMIActive()
        Do we have active NMIs?
        Returns:
        true if there are active NMIs on the bus.

      • clearNMI

        void clearNMI()
        Clear active NMIs as they are latched when the device IRQ changes from low to high. If the NMI is not cleared then there would be recursive interrupt handling.

      • isFIRQActive

        boolean isFIRQActive()
        Do we have active FIRQs?
        Returns:
        true if there are active FIRQs on the bus.

      • getCycleCounter

        long getCycleCounter()
        Get the number of read/writes to bus since the start.
        Returns:
        the number of cycles.

      • callbackIn

        void callbackIn(int cycles,
                Signal method)
        Ask the bus to call a given method when the number of read/write operations has reached given number.
        Parameters:
        cycles - - the number of cycles to trigger at
        method - - the operation to call.
